website_summaries.verdict: Quality design with foam grips and rubber nonslip feet make this set a value buy at its price point.
pros: High marks for quality of handgrips
Design is tilted slightly upward, which makes it ideal for targeting certain muscle groups, like pecs and arms
Assembly is simple, so it’s well-liked among travelers
Ideal for beginners and those with small workout spaces
cons: Some consumers find the set very flimsy and lightweight
It requires assembly and, as a result, frequent tightening

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, so far so good. Its plastic and sturdy, hopefully will last.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Junior

customer_reviews.title: my first impression was these looked pretty cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Upon first receiving these, my first impression was these looked pretty cheaply made. I still went ahead and opened them up and assembled them as described. For minimal flash, these work quite well. I have incorporated these into my P90x3 workouts each morning, and it makes the pushup exercises a lot more bearable and manageable. I have had a great improvement in the amount of reps I have been able to do during each workout. I had expected something heavy and better looking, but these were low maintenance, light, and collapsible for easy storage. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Affordable; get the job done
customer_reviews.text: These push-up bars are priced exactly right. They're lightweight and plastic, but designed just as well as a more expensive pair. Some very minor assembly is required (it'll take you less than a minute), and then they're good to go. Because they're so light, they'll travel easily. I try to do some low key strength training every morning, including body weight exercises. These bars have made my push-ups (always the most difficult for me) more bearable. Definitely recommended for any novices like myself trying to develop more upper body strength.
customer_reviews.author: Alcee Arobin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely sore the next day which is good. Quality on them can be improved from plastic to metal.
customer_reviews.text: These are very good for pushups. That is what I use them for. You will definitely feel it in your chest and shoulders the following day. There is a nice angle to the pushups bar which add to the comfort. The hold is nice too. Cons on this is that they are way too light. They are made of plastic; I wish some metal was used to make it more durable. Also, on my floors, even though there is some rubber on the bars, they still slip as I’m doing the pushups. I hope this was helpful. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Family7

customer_reviews.title: They work....a little unnatural feeling at first
customer_reviews.text: These push up bars were incredibly simple to assemble (took about 15 seconds--despite the instructions being missing) and they work fairly well for their intended purpose. If you're a push up lover but you find your weak link is the strain on your wrists, give these a try. They feel flimsy and I was initially anxious about putting my weight on them, but they are solidly built, despite their light weight. Easy to store. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Motes

customer_reviews.title: Great for push ups and relieving stress on the wrist
customer_reviews.text: I love using these FILA Accessories Push Up Bars. Doing push ups many times a week causes stress on your hands and wrists, but utilizing these bars really helps to relief it. They are quick and easy to assemble and can be easily taken with you while traveling. The grips are comfortable with some foam padding (not sure how long it will last, but so far so good). These have really made all the difference in my workouts and I would not go back to doing push ups without bars like this.
customer_reviews.author: midnight122

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight set, decent for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: They are plastic, took 20 seconds to assemble. The bars just slide in a groove over the feet , easy to disassemble for storage or to travel with on trips. The ones I use at the gym are metal but this is a decent, cheap alternative for use at home or travel (really won't add much to suit case weight). Each bar weighs 8.35 oz, so around 1 pound for the set, very light weight. Odd that the logo was only on three of the four bottoms, maybe a quality control issue. It did hold my weight, male at 175. They gripped the floor and didn't slide around. For $15, is decent enough.
customer_reviews.author: Parker-Moore Family

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Push-Up Bars
customer_reviews.text: When I got these, I was skeptical. They're plastic and weigh next to nothing. Surely, I thought, steel bars are required to support my 210 pounds in a push-up! And with so little weight, there's no way they'll stay in place! Well, don't I look sheepish now. Not only did they survive a number of push-ups, the rubber feet keep them securely in place on both carpet and tile. Yes, there's minor assembly required (the feet need to be shoved onto the bars), but that takes less than a minute before you're ready to go. Now get swole!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how comfortable these grips are. For me, the biggest thing is that they are slightly angled. This keeps the wrists in alignment. The padding around the handles was also very comfortable and seems pretty sturdy. Like all grips like this, you can use them in a wide variety of angles and they allow you to take the push-up deeper than if just on the floor. For someone like me with a history of carpal tunnel, these allow me to do push-ups that I simply could not do before.
customer_reviews.author: medieval mama

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It’s amazing what a difference push up bats make over regular old pushups. It is easier to get the right form, the exercise is more comfortable, and you can dip down much lower than normal pushups for extra strength building. These are great quality and while made of plastic, they are super sturdy. I was a bit skeptical when I assembled (a ten second process of connecting the base to the hand bar) that these would be study, but they are so solid those concerns vanished immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Osprey

customer_reviews.title: For the price, fantastic.  Less than a minute to put together. These are plastic, not metal, so lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, fantastic. Less than a minute to put together. These are plastic, not metal, so lightweight. The angle makes pushups less painful on your wrists but the pushups are harder, as you have a wider range to move through. Your wrists do get tired faster though! The rubber bumpers keep them from slipping, that worked fine on low pile carpet and a slightly rough tile but they did slip a bit on a very smooth floor. For fifteen bucks these are a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Two kids mom

customer_reviews.title: Fine for my limited needs.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a little bit of help in doing a few pushups a day. I was surprised that these are all-plastic construction, but they seem sturdy enough for my needs. A plus is that they disassemble fairly easily for storage or packing for your trip. For what I need, they’re fine. A dedicated bodybuilder might think differently. Jerry
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Saperstein

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy push-up bars
customer_reviews.text: These lightweight but sturdy push-up bars are an aid for me when I’m doing planks. They lessen the strain, and the pain, on my wrists. And they make it easier for me to get up from the floor. The parts snap together — no tools needed — and the rubber tips keep the bars from sliding on a hard surface. The rubber grips are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Divascribe

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight and work well for pushups, as intended. I like that there is a slight tilt on them to provide the right angle for pushups. It's definitely less strain on the wrists when using these.
customer_reviews.author: NAC

customer_reviews.title: Works like it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: These are simple, yet very functional push up bars. They have a slight angle to them that has helped me a lot. Very comfortable to use and easy on the wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Library Girl Reads

customer_reviews.title: Lighter, for home use
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit lighter than something you would find at a gym that is getting constant use. That being said, they are solid, designed well, and work.
customer_reviews.author: Bukkene Bruse

customer_reviews.title: Work very well.Lightweight and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly fine. Solid and stable. I like that they are lightweight and easy to store. The angle in the bars works well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: basic and excellent
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty self explanatory. It was just what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: OneTiredMother

product_meta.title: FILA Accessories Push Up Bars (Set of 2)
product_meta.description: These 5.5” high bars feature comfort-foam covered hand grips that minimize and provide relief from hand, wrist and elbow stress during push-up exercises while the non-slip end-caps provide increased stability.
feature_bullets: MINIMIZES STRESS: The 5.5” high bars minimize and provide relief from hand, wrist and elbow stress during push-up exercises
COMFORT-GRIP FOAM HANDLES: Features comfort-foam covered hand grips
STURDY ENDCAPS: The non-slip end-caps provide increased stability
ENHANCE UPPER BODY STRENGTH: Ideal tool for enhancing upper body strength during bodyweight exercises
DOWNLOADABLE EXERCISE GUIDE INCLUDED: A guide is available to help get your started!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
